member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Enums.AccessModeSet
member.summary:
Collection of access mode bits. Used for defining how a device is accessed.
Low Level API: This set is used when a device is opened.The combination of different access modes specifies how the device is opened. Not all combinations may be allowed because the device implementations have certain restrictions.
See also: The method of IDevice.Open() uses it to define a default value.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Enums.CacheUsage
member.summary: Lists the cache usage strategies. The cache stores preprocessed camera description xml files providing faster access or smaller footprint.
member.remarks: The environment variable GENICAM_CACHE_VERSION, e.g. GENICAM_CACHE_V3_0, must contain the path to cache directory for using the cache.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Enums.CacheUsage.Automatic
member.summary: The use of cache files is determined automatically.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Enums.CacheUsage.ForceWrite
member.summary: Forces the loading and preprocessing of the camera description xml file. If a cache directory is available the result of preprocessing is written to the cache.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Enums.CacheUsage.ForceRead
member.summary: Suppresses loading and preprocessing of the camera description xml file and forces reading a cache file from cache directory. Fails if no matching cache file is available.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Enums.CacheUsage.Ignore
member.summary: Forces the loading and preprocessing of the camera description xml file. No cache file is written.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS
member.summary: Represents the options used for AVI compression when saving video streams. This structure is used to configure various settings related to compression, such as codec type, quality, and interleaving options.
member.remarks: This structure is typically used with functions that manipulate AVI files to specify compression parameters. Ensure proper allocation and management of pointers (`lpFormat` and `lpParms`) when working with unmanaged memory.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.fccType
member.summary: Specifies the type of data to be compressed (e.g., 'vids' for video or 'auds' for audio).

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.fccHandler
member.summary: Specifies the four-character code (FOURCC) of the codec handler to be used for compression.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.dwKeyFrameEvery
member.summary: Defines the frequency of keyframes in the compressed stream. A value of zero indicates the default keyframe frequency of the codec.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.dwQuality
member.summary: Specifies the quality level of compression, ranging from 0 (lowest) to 10000 (highest).

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.dwBytesPerSecond
member.summary: Sets the target data rate for the compressed stream, in bytes per second. A value of zero indicates no restriction on the data rate.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.dwFlags
member.summary: Contains flags specifying additional compression options. For example, bit flags can indicate specific codec behaviors or optimizations.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.lpFormat
member.summary: Pointer to a structure containing format-specific data for the stream. This can vary depending on the codec and media type.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.cbFormat
member.summary: Specifies the size of the format-specific data referenced by , in bytes.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.lpParms
member.summary: Pointer to a structure containing codec-specific parameters for compression.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.cbParms
member.summary: Specifies the size of the codec-specific parameters referenced by , in bytes.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.dwInterleaveEvery
member.summary: Specifies the frequency of interleaving in the AVI file. For example, a value of 1 indicates that audio and video frames are interleaved frame by frame.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSF
member.summary: Specifies flags used to control AVI compression behavior. These flags can be combined using a bitwise OR operation to specify multiple options.
member.remarks: This enumeration is marked with the , which allows bitwise combinations of its values. These flags are typically used when configuring AVI compression settings in conjunction with .

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSF.VALID
member.summary: Indicates that the compression settings are valid and ready to be used.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSF.INTERLEAVE
member.summary: Specifies that the audio and video streams should be interleaved during compression. Interleaving improves playback performance by keeping audio and video data aligned.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSF.KEYFRAMES
member.summary: Requests that keyframes should be included in the compressed stream. Keyframes are full frames used as reference points in video compression.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSF.DATARATE
member.summary: Indicates that a specific data rate should be maintained during compression. This is used to control the bitrate of the output stream.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AVICOMPRESSF.NOCOMPRESSION
member.summary: Specifies that no compression should be applied to the data. This is typically used for raw, uncompressed output.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AviCompressionOptions
member.summary: ///Wraps the AVI compression options of the Video for Window API

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AviCompressionOptions._parentWindow
member.summary: handle to the parent window for the Compression Options dialog box. See the Video for Windows API AviSaveOptions() MSDN documentation.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AviCompressionOptions._showDialog
member.summary: show Compression Options dialog box. See the Video for Windows API AviSaveOptions() MSDN documentation.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AviCompressionOptions._userDialogReturnOk
member.summary: Is set to true in the call to the CAviWriter::Open() method if the user pressed OK in the dialog. The compression is not set up if cancel has been pressed.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AviCompressionOptions._autoKeyFrameInsertionRate
member.summary: Indicates to insert a key frame every nth image when KeyFrameSelection_Auto is used.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AviCompressionOptions._compressionOptions
member.summary: The AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS structure needs to be set up with the four character code identifying the codec and the parameter settings of the codec.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AviCompressionOptions.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: To use compression set up the AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS structure. You can use the dialog provided by the Video for Windows API to do this by setting \c optionalShowDialog to true. Alternatively, fill the AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS structure with the four character code identifying the codec and the parameter settings of the codec. For more information, see the MSDN documentation of the Video for Windows API and the documentation of the codec you are using.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AviCompressionOptions.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: To use compression set up the AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS structure. You can use the dialog provided by the Video for Windows API to do this by setting \c optionalShowDialog to true. Alternatively, fill the AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS structure with the four character code identifying the codec and the parameter settings of the codec. For more information, see the MSDN documentation of the Video for Windows API and the documentation of the codec you are using.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AviCompressionOptions.MakeFourCC(System.Char,System.Char,System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Creates a FOURCC (Four Character Code) identifier from four individual characters. A FOURCC is a 32-bit unsigned integer used to identify data formats or compression types.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an AVI writer object.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.Open(System.String,System.Double,Basler.Pylon.PixelType,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Basler.Pylon.ImageOrientation,System.Nullable{Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.AviCompressionOptions})
member.summary:
Opens an AVI file for writing.
If a file with the same filename already exists, it will be overwritten.
member.param: Name and path of the image.
The frame rate of the AVI file when shown in a media player.
The pixel type of the image in the AVI file.
The number of pixels in a row.
The number of rows of the image.
The vertical orientation of the image data in the AVI file.
Compression can be enabled by passing compression options. See SAviCompressionOptions.
member.remarks:
Precondition:
The AVI file is closed.
The pixelType is either PixelType_Mono8, PixelType_BGR8packed or PixelType_BGRA8packed
The width value must be > 0 and _I32_MAX.
The height value must be > 0 and _I32_MAX.
Errors: Throws an exception if the AVI file cannot be opened. Throws an exception if the preconditions are not met. Threading: This method is synchronized using the lock provided by GetLock().

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.IsOpen
member.summary: Returns the open state of the AVI file.
member.returns: Returns true if open.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions. Threading: This method is synchronized using the lock provided by GetLock().

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.Close
member.summary: Closes the AVI file.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions. Threading: This method is synchronized using the lock provided by GetLock().

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.Add(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage,Basler.Pylon.Internals.Enums.KeyFrameSelection)
member.summary:
Adds the image to the AVI file. Converts the image to the correct format if required.
The image is automatically converted to the format passed when opening the file if needed. The image is also converted if the stride of the passed image is not aligned to 4 byte. The image is also converted if the orientation of the passed image does mot match the value passed when opening the AVI file.
If more control over the conversion is required, the CImageFormatConverter class can be used to convert other images with a CPylonBitmapImage object as target. The CPylonBitmapImage object can then be added to the AVI file.
member.param: The image to add, e.g. a CPylonImage, CPylonBitmapImage, or Grab Result Smart Pointer object.
Can be used to control key frame selection for compressed images if needed.
member.remarks:
Precondition:
The file is open.
The image added is valid.
The pixel type of the image to add is a supported input format of the Pylon::CImageFormatConverter.
The width and height of the image match the values passed when opening the AVI file.
The total size of the AVI file must not exceed 2 GB. See CAviWriter::GetImageDataBytesWritten().
Errors: Throws an exception if the image cannot be added. Threading: This method is synchronized using the lock provided by GetLock().

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.Add(System.IntPtr,System.UInt64,Basler.Pylon.PixelType,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt64,Basler.Pylon.ImageOrientation,Basler.Pylon.Internals.Enums.KeyFrameSelection)
member.summary:
Adds the image to the AVI file. Converts the image to the correct format if required.
See Add( const Image) for more details.
member.param: The pointer to the buffer of the image.
The size of the buffer in byte.
The pixel type of the image to save.
The number of pixels in a row of the image to save.
The number of rows of the image to save.
The number of extra data bytes at the end of each line.
The vertical orientation of the image in the image buffer.
Can be used to control key frame selection for compressed images if needed.
member.remarks:
Precondition:
The file is open.
The image added is valid.
The pixel type of the image to add is a supported input format of the Pylon::CImageFormatConverter.
The width and height of the image match the values passed when opening the AVI file.
The total size of the AVI file must not exceed 2 GB. See CAviWriter::GetImageDataBytesWritten().
Errors: Throws an exception if the image cannot be added. Threading: This method is synchronized using the lock provided by GetLock().

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.CanAddWithoutConversion(Basler.Pylon.PixelType,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt64,Basler.Pylon.ImageOrientation)
member.summary: Can be used to check whether the given image is added to the AVI file without prior conversion when Add() is called.
member.param: The pixel type of the image to save.
The number of pixels in a row of the image to save.
The number of rows of the image to save.
The number of extra data bytes at the end of each row.
The vertical orientation of the image data in the AVI file.
member.returns: Returns true if the image is added to the AVI stream without prior conversion when Add() is called. Returns false if the image is automatically converted when Add() is called. Returns false if the image cannot be added at all. See the preconditions of Add() for more information.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.CanAddWithoutConversion(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage)
member.summary: Can be used to check whether the given image is added to the AVI file without prior conversion when Add() is called.
member.param: The image to save, e.g. a CPylonImage, CPylonBitmapImage, or Grab Result Smart Pointer object.
member.returns: Returns true if the image is added to the AVI stream without prior conversion when Add() is called. Returns false if the image is automatically converted when Add() is called. Returns false if the image cannot be added at all. See the preconditions of Add() for more information.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.GetCountOfAddedImages
member.summary: Provides access to the number of images that have been added to the AVI file.
member.returns: Returns the number of images that have been added to the AVI file. Returns 0 if no AVI file has been written yet.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.GetImageDataBytesWritten
member.summary:
Provides access to the number of image data bytes written to the AVI file.
This value is updated with each call to AviWriter::Add().
Depending on the used image format and codec, about 5 KB of header information and padding bytes are written to the AVI file. Furthermore, 24 additional bytes are needed per image for chunk header and index entry data.
member.returns: Returns the number of image data bytes that have been written to the AVI file. Returns 0 if no AVI File has been written yet. This size does not include the sizes of the AVI file header and AVI file index.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.summary: Destroys the AVI writer object.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.CastToParent
member.summary: Casts the to parent.
member.returns: Native pointer to the object of parent type.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.AviWriter.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.BufferFactory
member.summary: Usable to create a custom buffer factory when needed.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.BufferFactory.AllocateBuffer(System.UInt64,System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Allocates a buffer and provides additional context information.
member.param: The size of the buffer that has to be allocated.
Return the pointer to the allocated buffer. May return nint.Zero> if the allocation fails.
Context information that belongs to the buffer. This context information is provided when FreeBuffer() is called. The value can be set to nint.Zero if not needed.
member.remarks: Threading: This method can be run by different threads. It is called from threads that call CInstantCamera.StartGrabbing() and it can be called by the internal grab engine thread. Errors: May throw an exception if the allocation fails.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.BufferFactory.FreeBuffer(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Frees a previously allocated buffer.
member.param: The pointer to the allocated buffer. Created by this factory.
Context information of the buffer returned by AllocateBuffer().
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.BufferFactory.DestroyBufferFactory
member.summary:
Destroys the buffer factory.
This method is called when the buffer factory is not needed any longer. The object implementing IBufferFactory can be deleted by calling: delete this.
member.remarks: Threading: This method can be run by different threads. It is called from threads that are running the destructor of a Pylon::CGrabResultPtr or call Pylon::CInstantCamera::StopGrabbing(). Errors: exceptions from this call will be caught and ignored.

The cought exception.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ConfigurationEventHandler
member.summary: The configuration event handler base class.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ConfigurationEventHandler.OnAttach(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.InstantCamera)
member.summary:
This method is called before a Pylon Device (IPylonDevice) is attached by calling the Instant Camera object's Attach() method.
This method can not be used for detecting that a camera device has been attached to the PC. The camera's Attach() method must not be called from here or from subsequent calls to avoid infinite recursion.
member.param: The source of the call.
member.remarks: Errors: Exceptions from this call will be caught and ignored. All event handlers are notified. Threading: This method is called inside the lock of the camera object.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ConfigurationEventHandler.OnAttached(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.InstantCamera)
member.summary:
This method is called after a Pylon Device (IPylonDevice) has been attached by calling the Instant Camera object's Attach() method.
This method can not be used for detecting that a camera device has been attached to the PC. The camera's Attach() method must not be called from here or from subsequent calls to avoid infinite recursion.
member.param: The source of the call.
member.remarks: Errors: Exceptions from this call will be caught and ignored. All event handlers are notified. Threading: This method is called inside the lock of the camera object.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ConfigurationEventHandler.OnDetach(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.InstantCamera)
member.summary:
This method is called before the attached Pylon Device is detached from the Instant Camera object.
The camera's Detach() method must not be called from here or from subsequent calls to avoid infinite recursion.
member.param: The source of the call.
member.remarks: Errors: Exceptions from this call will be caught and ignored. All event handlers are notified. Threading: This method is called inside the lock of the camera object.

This method is called before the attached Pylon Device is destroyed.
Camera DestroyDevice must not be called from here or from subsequent calls to avoid infinite recursion.
member.param: The source of the call.
member.remarks: Errors: Exceptions from this call will be caught and ignored. All event handlers are notified. Threading: This method is called inside the lock of the camera object.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ConfigurationEventHandler.OnGrabError(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.InstantCamera,System.String)
member.summary:
This method is called when an exception has been triggered during grabbing.
An exception has been triggered by a grab thread. The grab will be stopped after this event call.
member.param: The source of the call.
The message of the exception that signaled an error during grabbing.
member.remarks: Errors: Exceptions from this call will be caught and ignored. All event handlers are notified. Threading: This method is called inside the lock of the camera object.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ConfigurationEventHandler.OnCameraDeviceRemoved(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.InstantCamera)
member.summary:
This method is called when a camera device removal from the PC has been detected.
The Pylon Device attached to the Instant Camera is not operable after this event. After it is made sure that no access to the Pylon Device or any of its node maps is made anymore the Pylon Device should be destroyed using InstantCamera.DeviceDestroy(). The access to the Pylon Device can be protected using the lock provided by GetLock(), e.g. when accessing parameters.
member.param: The source of the call.
member.remarks: Errors: Exceptions from this call will be caught and ignored. All event handlers are notified. Threading: This method is called inside the lock of the camera object from an additional thread.

member.summary: This method is called when the configuration event handler has been registered.
member.param: The source of the call.
member.remarks: Errors: Exceptions from this call will propagate through. Threading: This method is called inside the lock of the camera object.

member.summary:
This method is called when the configuration event handler has been deregistered.
The configuration event handler is automatically deregistered when the Instant Camera object is destroyed.
member.param: The source of the call.
member.remarks: Errors: Exceptions from this call will be caught and ignored. Threading: This method is called inside the lock of the camera object.

member.summary: Destroys the configuration event handler.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.FeaturePersistence
member.summary:
Utility class for saving and restoring camera features to and from a file or string.
NOTE: When saving features, the behavior of cameras supporting sequencers depends on the current setting of the "SequenceEnable" (some GigE models) or "SequencerConfigurationMode" (USB only) features respectively.
Only if the sequencer is in configuration mode, are the sequence sets exported. Otherwise, the camera features are exported without sequence sets.

member.summary: Loads the features from the file to the node map.
member.param: Name of the file that contains the node map values.
The node map
If validate==true, all node values will be validated. In case of an error, a GenICam::RuntimeException will be thrown
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if loading fails.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Global.PylonInitialize
member.summary:
Initializes the pylon runtime system.
You must call PylonInitialize before calling any other pylon functions. When finished you must call PylonTerminate to free up all resources used by pylon.
You can use the helperclass PylonAutoInitTerm to let the compiler call PylonInitialze and PylonTerminate.
Just create a local object on the stack in your main function and the constructor and destructor will call the functions. See PylonAutoInitTerm for a sample.
PylonInitialize/PylonTerminate is reference counted. For every call of PylonInitialize, a call to PylonTerminate is required. The last call to PylonTerminate will free up all resources.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Global.PylonTerminate(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Frees up resources allocated by the pylon runtime system.
Call this function before terminating the application. Don't use any pylon methods or pylon objects after having called PylonTerminate().
PylonInitialize/PylonTerminate is reference counted. For every call of PylonInitialize, a call to PylonTerminate is required. The last call to PylonTerminate will free up all resources.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Global.GetPylonVersion(System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary:
Returns the version number of pylon
It is possible to pass a NULL pointer for a version number category if the value is not of interest.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Global.DisplayImage(System.Int64,Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage)
member.summary: Convenience function to display an image on screen with one function call.
member.param: The window used for displaying the image. Valid window indexes range from 0 to 31.

The image to display in the window, specified in winIndex.
This convenience function displays the image or grab result passed in the \a image parameter in a window on the screen. Using this function is the easiest way to display an image on the screen.
If the window hasn't been created before, it will be created with default positions and the image will be shown. When the function returns, you can free/delete the image. If you need more control over the window creation (e.g. to specify the position or size of the window), you can use the PylonImageWindow class.
When you pass an empty/invalid (e.g. image.IsValid() returns false) image, the window will be cleared.
member.remarks:
Postcondition:
The window specified by \a winIndex will be created and shown on the screen.
If the passed image is valid, it is shown in the window specified by \a winIndex.
If the passed image is invalid, the window specified by \a winIndex will be cleared.
Errors: Can throw an exception if the passed winIndex is invalid or the window could not be created. Threading: This function is thread-safe.

member.summary:
Returns the bit depth of a value of the pixel in bits.
This may be less than the size needed to store the pixel. BitDepth(PixelType.Mono12) returns 12, BitDepth(PixelType.Mono12packed) returns 12, and BitDepth(PixelType.RGB8packed) returns 8 for example.
member.param: Type of the pixel.
member.returns: The bit depth of a value of the pixel in bits.
member.remarks: Precondition: The pixel type must be valid. Errors: Throws an exception when the pixel type is undefined.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Global.ComputeStride(System.Int64@,Basler.Pylon.PixelType,System.UInt32,System.Int64)
member.summary:
Computes the stride in byte.
The stride indicates the number of bytes between the beginning of one row in an image and the beginning of the next row. For planar pixel types the returned value represents the stride of a plane.
The stride in bytes cannot be computed for packed image format when the stride is not byte aligned and paddingX == 0. If paddingX is larger than zero and the stride without padding is not byte aligned then the rest of the partially filled byte is considered as padding, e.g. pixelType = PixelType_Mono12packed, width = 5, paddingX = 10 results in a stride of 18 Bytes (stride without padding is 5 * BitPerPixel( PixelType_Mono12packed) = 5 * 12 = 60 Bits = 7.5 Bytes).
The stride can also be not computed for planar YUV422 and YUV420 image formats.
See also Pylon::IsPacked().
member.param: The stride in byte if it can be computed.
The pixel type.
The number of pixels in a row.
The number of additional bytes at the end of a row (byte aligned).
member.returns: Returns true if the stride can be computed.
member.remarks: Precondition: The width value must be >= 0 and <= _I32_MAX. Errors: Throws an exception when the preconditions are not met.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Global.ComputeBufferSize(Basler.Pylon.PixelType,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Computes the buffer size in byte.
member.param: The pixel type.
The number of pixels in a row.
The number of rows in an image.
The number of extra data bytes at the end of each row (byte aligned).
member.returns: The buffer size in byte.
member.remarks:
Precondition:
The pixel type must be valid.
The width value must be >= 0 and <= _I32_MAX.
The height value must be >= 0 and <= _I32_MAX.
Errors: Throws an exception when the preconditions are not met.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.GrabResult
member.summary:
Combined wrapper for native CGrabResultPtr and CGrabResultData objects.
Holds a reference to grab result data.
This class is used for distributing the grab result data of a camera. It controls the reuse and lifetime of the referenced buffer. When all smart pointers referencing a buffer go out of scope the referenced buffer is reused or destroyed. The data and the held buffer are still valid after the camera object it originated from has been destroyed.
member.remarks: The grabbing will stop with an input queue underrun, when the grab results are never released, e.g.when put into a container.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.GrabResult.GetBlockID
member.summary:
Get the block ID of the grabbed frame (camera device specific). GigE Camera Devices If the Extended ID mode is disabled (default), the sequence number starts with 1 and wraps at 65535. If the Extended ID mode is enabled, the sequence number starts with 1 and uses the full 64-bit unsigned integer value range.
A value of 0 indicates that this feature is not supported by the camera. You can configure the Extended ID mode by setting the GevGVSPExtendedIDMode or the BslGevGVSPExtendedIDMode parameter, if available. The Instant Camera class and the pylon GigE stream grabber provide additional parameters for controlling the Extended ID mode.
USB Camera Devices The sequence number starts with 0 and uses the full 64 Bit range.
ATTENTION: A block ID with the value UINT64_MAX indicates that the block ID is invalid and must not be used.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.GrabResult.GetTimeStamp
member.summary: Get the camera specific tick count (camera device specific). This describes when the image exposure was started. Cameras that do not support this feature return zero. If supported, this can be used to determine which image AOIs were acquired simultaneously.

member.summary: Get the stride in bytes.
member.param: The stride in bytes.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.GrabResult.GetID
member.summary: Get the ID of the grabbed image. Always returns a number larger than 0. The counting starts with 1 and is never reset during the lifetime of the Instant Camera object.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.GrabResult.GetImageNumber
member.summary: Get the number of the image. This number is incremented when an image is retrieved using CInstantCamera::RetrieveResult(). Always returns a number larger than 0. The counting starts with 1 and is reset with every call to CInstantCamera::StartGrabbing().

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.GrabResult.GetNumberOfSkippedImages
member.summary: Get the number of skipped images before this image. This value can be larger than 0 if EGrabStrategy_LatestImageOnly grab strategy or GrabStrategy_LatestImages grab strategy is used. Always returns a number larger than or equal 0. This number does not include the number of images lost in case of a buffer underrun in the driver.

member.summary: Returns true if chunk data is available. This is the case if the chunk mode is enabled for the camera device. member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDevice
member.summary: Low Level API: The interface implemented by all device objects.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDevice.Open(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Enums.AccessModeSet)
member.summary:
Opens a device The open method initializes all involved drivers and establishes a connection to the device.
A device may support different access modes, e.g. EDeviceAccessMode::Exclusive providing an exclusive access to the device.
member.param: The desired device access mode

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDevice.Close
member.summary: Closes a device The close method closes all involved drivers and an existing connection to the device will be released. Other applications now can access the device.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDevice.IsOpen
member.summary: Checks if a device already is opened
member.returns:
true, when the device already has been opened by the calling application.
NOTE: When a device has been opened an application A, IsOpen() will return false when called by an application B not having called the device's open method.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDevice.AccessMode
member.summary: Returns the access mode used to open the device

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDevice.GetDeviceInfo
member.summary: Returns the device info object storing information like the device's name.
member.returns: A reference to the device info object used to create the device by a device factory

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDeviceFactory.EnumerateDevices(System.Collections.Generic.List{Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.DeviceInfo},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of available devices. The list contains Pylon::CDeviceInfo objects used for the device creation and is ordered by device class and serial number using the operator Pylon::CDeviceInfo::operator<(). By default, the list will be cleared before the device discovery is started.
member.param: List to be filled with device info objects.
If true, the devices found will be appended to the list instead of deleting the list. Only newly discovered devices are sorted and not the entire list.
member.returns: Number of devices found.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDeviceFactory.EnumerateDevices(System.Collections.Generic.List{Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.DeviceInfo},System.Collections.Generic.List{Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.DeviceInfo},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of available devices filtered by given properties, usable for looking for specific devices. The list contains Pylon::CDeviceInfo objects used for the device creation and is ordered by device class and serial number using the operator Pylon::CDeviceInfo::operator<(). By default, the list will be cleared before the device discovery is started. The filter list can contain a list of device info objects containing properties a device must have, e.g., the user-provided name or the serial number. A device is returned if it matches the properties of any of the device info objects on the filter list. If the device class property is set in the filter device info objects, the search is limited to the required transport layers.
member.param: List to be filled with device info objects.
A list of device info objects with user-provided properties that a device can match.
If true, the devices found will be appended to the list instead of deleting the list. Only newly discovered devices are sorted and not the entire list.
member.returns: Number of devices found.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDeviceFactory.CreateDevice(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.DeviceInfo)
member.summary:
Creates a camera object from a device info object. This method accepts either a device info object from a device enumeration or a user-provided device info object. User-provided device info objects can be preset with properties required for a device, e.g. the user-provided name or the serial number. The implementation tries to find a matching camera by using device enumeration. When the device class property is set, the search is limited to the required transport layer.
If the device creation fails, a GenApi::GenericException will be thrown.
member.param: Device info object containing all information needed to identify exactly one device.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDeviceFactory.CreateFirstDevice(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.DeviceInfo)
member.summary: If multiple devices match the provided properties, the first device found is created. The order in which the devices are found can vary from call to call.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDeviceFactory.CreateDevice(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.DeviceInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates a camera object from a device info object, injecting additional GenICam XML definition strings. Currently only one injected xml string is supported.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDeviceFactory.CreateFirstDevice(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.DeviceInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Creates the first found camera device matching the provided properties, injecting additional GenICam XML definition strings. Currently only one injected xml string is supported.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDeviceFactory.CreateDevice(System.String)
M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDeviceFactory.DestroyDevice(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IPylonDevice)
member.summary: Destroys a device. NOTE: Never try to delete a pointer to a camera device by calling free or delete. Always use the DestroyDevice method.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IDeviceFactory.IsDeviceAccessible(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.DeviceInfo,Basler.Pylon.Internals.Enums.AccessModeSet,Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.Helpers.Optional{Basler.Pylon.DeviceAccessibilityInfo})
member.summary:
This method can be used to check if a camera device can be created and opened.
This method accepts either a device info object from a device enumeration or a user-provided device info object. User-provided device info objects can be preset with properties required for a device, e.g. the user-provided name or the serial number. The implementation tries to find a matching camera by using device enumeration. When the device class property is set, see \ref DeviceClass.h header file, the search is limited to the required transport layer. For more information, see \ref UsingEnumeraionWithFilter "Applying a Filter when Enumerating Cameras".
member.param: Properties to find/identify the camera device to check.

Used for defining how a device is accessed. The use of the mode information is transport layer-specific. - For \ref Pylon::BaslerCameraLinkDeviceClass "CameraLink", and \ref Pylon::BaslerUsbDeviceClass "USB" devices, the mode information is ignored. - For \ref Pylon::BaslerGigEDeviceClass "GigE" devices, the Exclusive and Control flags are used for defining how a device is accessed. Other mode information is ignored. - For devices of any type that are accessed via the \ref Pylon::BaslerGenTlDeviceClassPrefix "GenICam GenTL" transport layer, the mode is ignored.
Provides more information about whether a device is accessible or not.
member.returns: True if device can be opened with provided access mode.
member.remarks: Precondition: The deviceInfo object properties specify exactly one device. This is the case when the device info object has been obtained using device enumeration. Errors: Throws an exception, if the preconditions are not met.

member.summary: Wrapper class for the native object implementing the interface.
member.remarks: Does not control lifetime of the native object.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer
member.summary: Extends the ITransportLayer interface by GigE Vision specific functionality.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.CommandResult
member.summary: Optional result structure of and .

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.CommandResult.CommandStatus
member.summary: Lists possible status codes returned by and .

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.CommandResult.CommandStatus.Ok
member.summary: The device acknowledged the command.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.CommandResult.CommandStatus.NoRefTime
member.summary: The device is not synchronized to a master clock to be used as time reference. Typically used when scheduled action commands cannot be scheduled for a future time since the reference time coming from IEEE 1588 is not locked. The action command has been ignored by the device.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.CommandResult.CommandStatus.Overflow
member.summary: Returned when the scheduled action commands queue is full and the device cannot accept the additional request. The action command has been discarded by the device.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.CommandResult.CommandStatus.ActionLate
member.summary: The requested scheduled action command was requested at a point in time that is in the past. If the time tag of the scheduled action command is in the past (relative to the device timestamp), and if it is a valid action command, then the device will execute this action command immediately and return . This status code is used as an indicator to the application requesting the action command that a mis-synchronization might have occurred.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.CommandResult.DeviceAddress
member.summary: IP address of the device.

member.name: F:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.CommandResult.Status
member.summary: GigE Vision status code returned by the device. See for more information.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.EnumerateAllDevices(System.Collections.Generic.List{Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.DeviceInfo},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enumerates all available Basler GigE Vision devices In contrast to the ITransportLayer::EnumerateDevices method, devices having a subnet configured that is different from the subnet of the application will be listed.
All Basler GigE Vision devices will be listed, including the Basler blaze, which is usually not considered by the GigE transport layer.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.ForceIp(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
"Force" a static IP address configuration in a device identified by its MAC Address This applies to all Basler GigE Vision devices, including the Basler blaze, which isn't usually considered by the GigE transport layer.
NOTE: When calling this function, there must be no opened camera object for the device to be reconfigured!
member.param: MAC address as a string, no delimiters are used. e.g., 003053061a58
Temporary IP address, "dot notation", e.g., 192.168.1.2
Temporary SubnetMask, "dot notation", e.g. 255.255.255.0
Temporary DefaultGateway, "dot notation", e.g., 192.168.1.1

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.RestartIpConfiguration(System.String)
member.summary: Let a device restart the IP configuration cycle NOTE: This function fails when the device is open, i.e., a control channel is established
member.param: MAC address as a string, no delimiters are used, e.g., 003053061a58

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.AnnounceRemoteDevice(System.String,Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.DeviceInfo)
member.summary:
Announce that a remote device is going to be used This applies to all Basler GigE Vision devices, including the Basler blaze, which isn't usually considered by the GigE transport layer.
NOTE: This device must be reachable, a route is configured.
member.param: address of device in "dot notation"
This optional parameter holds the full device info if found

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.RenounceRemoteDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Stop using remote device.
member.param: address of device in "dot notation"

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.BroadcastIpConfiguration(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Broadcast a new IP configuration All Basler GigE Vision devices can be configured, including the Basler blaze, which isn't usually considered by the GigE transport layer. When configuring a blaze camera, some options may not be supported. Please check the camera documentation for more information.
member.param: MAC address as a string, no delimiters are used. e.g., 003053061a58
If true, a persistent Ip address will be set
If true, DHCP is enabled
Device's new IP address, "dot notation", e.g., 192.168.1.2
Device's new SubnetMask, "dot notation", e.g. 255.255.255.0
Device's new DefaultGateway, "dot notation", e.g., 192.168.1.1
Device's new UserdefinedName, maximal 16 character
member.returns: true if configuration was successfully written

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.IssueActionCommand(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.String,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Collections.Generic.List{Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.CommandResult})
member.summary: Issue a broadcast action command.
member.param: The device key addresses devices managed by an application. The device key is only known to the application controlling its camera devices and it ensures that only this application can trigger the camera devices. Therefore the device key cannot be read from a device. An exact match of the send deviceKey and the device key stored in a device is required for executing an action.
The group key is used to create groups of devices or actions. An exact match of the send groupKey and the group key stored in a device for an action is required for executing an action.

The groupMask is a bit mask that allows to send an action to a subgroup of the devices addressed by the deviceKey groupKey pair. The result of a bitwise AND operation of groupMask and the group mask stored in a device for an action must be non-zero for executing an action.

BroadcastAddress in dot notation where the command will be broadcast to, e.g. 255.255.255.255 (all adapters, default), 192.168.1.255 (all devices in a single subnet 192.168.1.xxx), 192.168.1.38 (single device). See the note below.

Optional: Time in milliseconds the call is waiting for acknowledges of the addressed devices. Waiting for acknowledges is stopped if pNumResults have been received. This parameter can be 0 if a check of action command results is not required.
Optional: The number of results in the array. The value passed should be equal to the expected number of devices that acknowledge the command. This parameter is ignored if is 0.

Optional: An Array with *pNumResults elements to hold the action command result status. The buffer is filled beginning from the start. Remaining results are not changed if less results are received than result items available. This parameter is ignored if timeoutMs is 0. Thus this parameter can be NULL if timeoutMs is 0.
member.returns:
Returns true if numResults have been received and the Status of all results is IGigEActionCommandResult.CommandStatus.Ok. Returns true if no results have been requested.
The action command feature lets you trigger actions in multiple devices (e.g. cameras) at roughly the same time or at a defined point in time (scheduled action command) by using a single broadcast protocol message (without extra cabling). Action commands are used in cameras in the same way as for example the digital input lines.
NOTE: The request is sent via all existing network adapters. If a network adapter has more than one IP address, the request is sent separately for each address. This is not executed simultaneously but consecutively, IP address by IP address. That's why additional latency is added to the execution time. Directed broadcasts (192.168.1.255) or unicasts (192.168.1.38) are only sent if the request subnet matches the subnet of the IP address, i.e., if no gateway or routing are required.
See \ref sample_Grab_UsingActionCommand and Pylon::CActionTriggerConfiguration for more information.
member.remarks:
Precondition:
IP4 addresses must be used.
groupMask must not be 0.
pNumResult, *pNumResult and results must not be 0 if a timeoutMs value other than 0 is passed.
Errors: Throws an exception if the preconditions are not met. Throws exceptions. Threading: The method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.IssueScheduledActionCommand(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt64,System.String,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Collections.Generic.List{Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IGigETransportLayer.CommandResult})
member.summary: Issue a scheduled action command via broadcast.
member.param: The device key addresses devices managed by an application. The device key is only known to the application controlling its camera devices and it ensures that only this application can trigger the camera devices. Therefore the device key cannot be read from a device. An exact match of the send deviceKey and the device key stored in a device is required for executing an action.
The group key is used to create groups of devices or actions. An exact match of the send groupKey and the group key stored in a device for an action is required for executing an action.

The groupMask is a bit mask that allows to send an action to a subgroup of the devices addressed by the deviceKey groupKey pair. The result of a bitwise AND operation of groupMask and the group mask stored in a device for an action must be non-zero for executing an action.

Time in nanoseconds when the action is to be executed. The actual value depends on the used master clock. A master clock value can be obtained for instance for a set of synchronized camera devices by reading the timestamp value (GevTimestampValue) after latching the timestamp value (GevTimestampControlLatch) from one camera device of the set

BroadcastAddress in dot notation where the command will be broadcast to, e.g. 255.255.255.255 (all adapters, default), 192.168.1.255 (all devices in a single subnet 192.168.1.xxx), 192.168.1.38 (single device). See the note below.

Optional: Time in milliseconds the call is waiting for acknowledges of the addressed devices. Waiting for acknowledges is stopped if pNumResults have been received. This parameter can be 0 if a check of action command results is not required.
Optional: The number of results in the array. The value passed should be equal to the expected number of devices that acknowledge the command. This parameter is ignored if is 0.

Optional: An Array with *pNumResults elements to hold the action command result status. The buffer is filled beginning from the start. Remaining results are not changed if less results are received than result items available. This parameter is ignored if timeoutMs is 0. Thus this parameter can be NULL if timeoutMs is 0.
member.remarks: Precondition: actionTimeNs must be smaller than or equal INT64_MAX.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage
member.summary: Provides access to image properties and image buffer.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.IsValid
member.summary: Can be used to check whether an image is valid.
member.returns: Returns false if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.GetPixelType
member.summary: Get the current pixel type.
member.returns: Returns the pixel type or PixelType_Undefined if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.GetWidth
member.summary: Get the current number of columns in pixels.
member.returns: Returns the current number of columns in pixels or 0 if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.GetHeight
member.summary: Get the current number of rows.
member.returns: Returns the current number of rows or 0 if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.GetPaddingX
member.summary: Get the number of extra data bytes at the end of each row.
member.returns: Returns the number of extra data bytes at the end of each row or 0 if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.GetOrientation
member.summary: Get the vertical orientation of the image in memory.
member.returns: Returns the orientation of the image or ImageOrientation_TopDown if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.GetBuffer
member.summary:
Get the buffer containing the image.
The buffer is at least as large as the value returned by GetImageSize().
member.returns: Returns the buffer or null if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.GetBufferPointer
member.summary:
Get the pointer to the buffer containing the image.
The buffer is at least as large as the value returned by GetImageSize().
member.returns: Returns the pointer to the used buffer or null if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.GetImageSize
member.summary: Get the size of the image in bytes.
member.returns: Returns the size of the image in bytes or 0 if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.IsUnique
member.summary: Indicates that the referenced buffer is only referenced by this image.
member.returns: Returns true if the referenced buffer is only referenced by this image. Returns false if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.GetStride(System.Int64@)
member.summary:
Get the stride in bytes.
The stride in bytes can not be computed for packed image format when the stride is not byte aligned. See also Pylon::IsPacked(). The stride in bytes can not be computed if the image is invalid.
member.param: The stride in byte if it can be computed.
member.returns: Returns true if the stride can be computed.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.Wrapper.GetOrientation
member.summary: Get the vertical orientation of the image in memory.
member.returns: Returns the orientation of the image or ImageOrientation_TopDown if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.Wrapper.GetBuffer
member.summary:
Get the buffer containing the image.
The buffer is at least as large as the value returned by GetImageSize().
member.returns: Returns the buffer or null if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.Wrapper.GetBufferPointer
member.summary:
Get the pointer to the buffer containing the image.
The buffer is at least as large as the value returned by GetImageSize().
member.returns: Returns the pointer to the used buffer or null if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.Wrapper.GetImageSize
member.summary: Get the size of the image in bytes.
member.returns: Returns the size of the image in bytes or 0 if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.Wrapper.IsUnique
member.summary: Indicates that the referenced buffer is only referenced by this image.
member.returns: Returns true if the referenced buffer is only referenced by this image. Returns false if the image is invalid.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IImage.Wrapper.GetStride(System.Int64@)
member.summary:
Get the stride in bytes.
The stride in bytes can not be computed for packed image format when the stride is not byte aligned. See also Pylon::IsPacked(). The stride in bytes can not be computed if the image is invalid.
member.param: The stride in byte if it can be computed.
member.returns: Returns true if the stride can be computed.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IInterface
member.summary: Provides convenient access to an interface.
member.remarks: An interface is used to represent a frame grabber board, a network card, etc. Currently, this object type is mainly used for the pylon GenTL Consumer Transport Layer, e.g., for CoaXPress. All other pylon transport layers currently return one default interface. The 'open' status of an interface instance won't change even if an attached camera is used, e.g., opened or closed.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IInterface.Open
member.summary:
Opens an interface to be able access it's parameters via GetNodeMap().
NOTE: You can use the methods provided by IDeviceFactory regardless of whether the interface is opened or closed.
member.remarks:
Postcondition:
The interface is open.
The node map can be accessed via GetNodeMap().
Threading: This method is thread-safe. Errors: Throws an exception if opening the interface fails.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IInterface.Close
member.summary: Closes an interface.
member.remarks:
Threading: This method is thread-safe. Postcondition:
The interface is closed.
Any previously acquired node map using GetNodeMap() has been deleted and must not be used any longer.
Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IInterface.IsOpen
member.summary:
Checks if the interface is open.
NOTE: The 'open' status of an interface instance won't change even if an attached camera is used, e.g., opened or closed.
member.returns: Returns true if when the interface is open.
member.remarks: Threading: This method is thread-safe. Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IInterface.GetInterfaceInfo
member.summary:
Returns the interface info object storing information like the Interface ID property.
This information is available at all times regardless of whether the interface is open or closed.
member.returns: A reference to the interface info object.
member.remarks: Threading: This method is thread-safe. Errors: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IInterface.GetNodeMap
member.summary:
Returns the GenApi node map used for accessing parameters provided by the interface.
NOTE: The default interface object does not provide a node map.
member.returns: Returns the GenApi node map used for accessing parameters provided by the interface. If no parameters are available, NULL is returned.
member.remarks: Threading: This method is thread-safe. Errors: Can throw exceptions.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IInterface.Wrapper
member.summary: Wrapper class for the native object implementing the interface.
member.remarks: Does not control lifetime of the native object.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IInterface.Wrapper.NativeObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference to the native object.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.IInterface.Wrapper.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The native object to wrap.
member.remarks: Does not control lifetime of the native object.

member.summary:
Opens an interface to be able access it's parameters via GetNodeMap().
NOTE: You can use the methods provided by IDeviceFactory regardless of whether the interface is opened or closed.
member.remarks:

The interface is open.
The node map can be accessed via GetNodeMap().
Threading: This method is thread-safe. Errors: Throws an exception if opening the interface fails.

Any previously acquired node map using GetNodeMap() has been deleted and must not be used any longer.

Checks if the interface is open.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.NativeObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference to the native object.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The native object to wrap.
if set to true wrapper will manage memory of the native object (i.e. will free it when destroyed).

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty decompressor without compression descriptor. This constructor does not initialize the decompressor with a compression descriptor. You will have to initialize the decompressor first by using one of the SetCompressionDescriptor methods in order to be able to decompress images. You will get an exception if you access methods that require the decompressor to be initialized (see method descriptions for which methods are affected by that precondition).
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if no memory can be allocated.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.#ctor(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor)
member.summary: Creates a decompressor by copying from another decompressor.
member.param: Decompressor to copy from during initialization.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if no memory can be allocated.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Creates a decompressor and initializes it with the compression descriptor provided.
member.param: Pointer to the compression descriptor. This parameter must not be NULL.
Size of the data (in bytes) of the compression descriptor.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if no memory can be allocated or the compression descriptor provided is invalid (e.g., because it is corrupt) or incompatible (e.g., because a compression descriptor of a newer compression implementation is passed).

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.#ctor(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.INodeMap)
member.summary: Creates a decompressor and initializes it with a compression descriptor that is retrieved from the camera's node map.
member.param: Node map of the camera to be used for retrieving the compression descriptor.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if no memory can be allocated or no proper compression descriptor can be retrieved from the camera.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.HasCompressionDescriptor
member.summary: Determines whether the decompressor already has a compression descriptor.
member.returns: Returns true if the decompressor is already initialized with a compression descriptor or false otherwise.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions. Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.ResetCompressionDescriptor
member.summary: Resets the compression descriptor in the decompressor. NOTE: After calling this method, no images can be decompressed by the decompressor because it is back in uninitialized state.
member.remarks: Errors: Does not throw exceptions. Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.SetCompressionDescriptor(System.IntPtr,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Initializes a decompressor with the compression descriptor provided.
member.param: Pointer to the compression descriptor. This parameter must not be NULL.
Size of the data (in bytes) of the compression descriptor.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if no memory can be allocated or the compression descriptor provided is invalid (e.g., because it is corrupt) or incompatible (e.g., because a compression descriptor of a newer compression implementation is passed). Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.SetCompressionDescriptor(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.INodeMap)
member.summary: Initializes a decompressor with a compression descriptor that is retrieved from the camera's node map.
member.param: Node map of the camera to be used for retrieving the compression descriptor.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if no memory can be allocated or no proper compression descriptor can be retrieved from the camera. Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.GetCompressionMode(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.INodeMap)
member.summary:
Retrieves the current compression mode from the camera's node map.
This indicates which kind of compression is active or whether compression is not enabled (or unavailable).
member.param: Node map of the camera to be used for retrieving the compression mode.
member.returns: Returns the current compression mode of the camera.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if an error is encountered while determining the compression mode. Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.GetCompressionDescriptor(System.IntPtr,System.UInt64@)
member.summary:
Gets the currently set compression descriptor.
This method requires that a compression descriptor has been set previously via the constructor or the SetCompressionDescriptor methods. You can determine this via the HasCompressionDescriptor method.
member.param: Pointer to the buffer that will receive the compression descriptor or NULL if you only want to get the size of the buffer for buffer allocation.

On input, the variable specifies the size of the buffer (in bytes) for the compression descriptor (if pCompressionDescriptor is not NULL). On output, the variable will receive the actual buffer size required for the current compression descriptor. This parameter must not be NULL.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if the decompressor has no compression descriptor set or the input parameters are invalid (e.g., if the size provided is not sufficient to hold the compression descriptor). Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.GetCompressionDescriptor(System.IntPtr,System.UInt64@,Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.INodeMap)
member.summary:
Gets the current compression descriptor from the camera's node map.
This method requires image compression to be enabled in the camera. You can determine this via the GetCompressionMode method.
member.param: Pointer to the buffer that will receive the compression descriptor or NULL if you only want to get the size of the buffer for buffer allocation.

On input, the variable specifies the size of the buffer (in bytes) for the compression descriptor (if pCompressionDescriptor is not NULL). On output, the variable will receive the actual buffer size required for the current compression descriptor. This parameter must not be NULL.
Node map of the camera to be used for retrieving the compression descriptor.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if compression is not enabled in the camera (or unavailable) or the input parameters are invalid (e.g., if the size provided is not sufficient to hold the compression descriptor). Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.GetCompressionInfo(Basler.Pylon.CompressionInfo@,System.IntPtr,System.UInt64,Basler.Pylon.Endianness)
member.summary: Gets compression information about a grab buffer.
member.param: Reference to the struct that will receive the compression information if the grab buffer contains such information.
Pointer to the grab buffer that holds the compressed data. This parameter must not be NULL.
Payload size (in bytes) of the data received (must be less or equal to the size of the grab buffer).
Endianness of the grab buffer's content. If not known, auto detection can be used.
member.returns: Returns true if compression information could be extracted from the the grab buffer or false otherwise.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if the input parameters are invalid. Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.ComputeCompressionDescriptorHash(System.IntPtr,System.UInt64@,System.IntPtr,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Computes the hash for a given compression descriptor.
member.param: Pointer to the buffer that will receive the compression descriptor hash or NULL if you only want to get the size of the buffer for buffer allocation.

On input, the variable specifies the size of the buffer (in bytes) for the compression descriptor hash (if pHash is not NULL). On output, the variable will receive the actual buffer size required for the current compression descriptor hash. This parameter must not be NULL.
Pointer to the compression descriptor. This parameter must not be NULL.
Size of the data (in bytes) of the compression descriptor.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if the input parameters are invalid (e.g., if the size provided is not sufficient to hold the compression descriptor hash). Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.GetCompressionDescriptorHash(System.IntPtr,System.UInt64@)
member.summary:
Gets the hash of the currently set compression descriptor.
This method requires that a compression descriptor has been set previously via the constructor or the SetCompressionDescriptor methods. You can determine this via the HasCompressionDescriptor method.
member.param: Pointer to the buffer that will receive the compression descriptor hash or NULL if you only want to get the size of the buffer for buffer allocation.

On input, the variable specifies the size of the buffer (in bytes) for the compression descriptor hash (if pHash is not NULL). On output, the variable will receive the actual buffer size required for the current compression descriptor hash. This parameter must not be NULL.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if the decompressor has no compression descriptor set or the input parameters are invalid (e.g., if the size provided is not sufficient to hold the compression descriptor hash). Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.GetCompressionDescriptorHash(System.IntPtr,System.UInt64@,Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.INodeMap)
member.summary:
Gets the hash of the current compression descriptor from the camera's node map.
This method requires image compression to be enabled in the camera. You can determine this via the GetCompressionMode method.
member.param: Pointer to the buffer that will receive the compression descriptor hash or NULL if you only want to get the size of the buffer for buffer allocation.

On input, the variable specifies the size of the buffer (in bytes) for the compression descriptor hash (if pHash is not NULL). On output, the variable will receive the actual buffer size required for the current compression descriptor hash. This parameter must not be NULL.
Node map of the camera to be used for retrieving the compression descriptor hash.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if compression is not active in the camera (or unavailable) or the input parameters are invalid (e.g., if the size provided is not sufficient to hold the compression descriptor hash). Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.GetCompressionDescriptorHash(System.IntPtr,System.UInt64@,System.IntPtr,System.UInt64,Basler.Pylon.Endianness)
member.summary: Gets the hash of the compression descriptor that is required for decompressing the grab buffer provided.
member.param: Pointer to the buffer that will receive the compression descriptor hash or NULL if you only want to get the size of the buffer for buffer allocation.

On input, the variable specifies the size of the buffer (in bytes) for the compression descriptor hash (if pHash is not NULL). On output, the variable will receive the actual buffer size required for the current compression descriptor hash. This parameter must not be NULL.
Pointer to the grab buffer that holds the compressed data. This parameter must not be NULL.
Payload size (in bytes) of the data received (must be less or equal to the size of the grab buffer).
Endianness of the grab buffer's content. If not known, auto detection can be used.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if the grab buffer does not contain compressed data, the data is corrupt, or the input parameters are invalid (e.g., if the size provided is not sufficient to hold the compression descriptor hash). Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.GetImageSizeForDecompression(Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.INodeMap)
member.summary:
Gets size (in bytes) required for allocating buffers for decompressing the images during streaming.
This method requires image compression to be enabled in the camera. You can determine this via the GetCompressionMode method.
member.param: Node map of the camera to be used for retrieving the image size required for decompression.
member.returns: Returns the buffer size (in bytes) required for image decompression.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if an error is encountered while determining the image size required for decompression. Threading: This method is thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.Internals.Native.ImageDecompressor.DecompressImage(System.IntPtr,Basler.Pylon.CompressionInfo@,System.UInt64@,System.IntPtr,System.UInt64)
member.summary:
Decompresses the image of the grab buffer provided.
This method requires that a compression descriptor has been set previously via the constructor or the SetCompressionDescriptor methods. You can determine this via the HasCompressionDescriptor method.
The grab buffer provided must contain a compressed image that has been received without errors.
member.param: Pointer to the buffer that will receive the decompressed image. This parameter must not be NULL.

On input, the variable specifies the size of the buffer (in bytes) for the decompressed image (must be larger or equal to the value in the decompressedImageSize field in the CompressionInfo_t struct received via the GetCompressionInfo methods; alternatively, the GetImageSizeForDecompression method can be used to get the image size required for decompression). On output, the variable will receive the actual buffer size required for the decompressed image. This parameter must not be NULL.
Pointer to the grab buffer that holds the compressed data. This parameter must not be NULL.
Payload size (in bytes) of the data received (must be less or equal to the size of the grab buffer).
Payload size (in bytes) of the data received (must be less or equal to the size of the grab buffer).
member.returns: Returns the struct with the compression information of the compressed image.
member.remarks: Errors: Throws an exception if the grab buffer does not contain compressed data, the data is corrupt, the image cannot be decompressed, or the input parameters are invalid (e.g., if the size provided is not sufficient to hold the decompressed image). Threading: This method is thread-safe.
