member.summary: The vertical orientation of the pixel data stored in memory.

remarks.para: Preconditions: The data component must be valid.
Error Safety: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.IDataContainer
member.summary: Provides methods for accessing grab results consisting of multiple components

remarks.para: Some cameras can return complex grab results consisting of multiple components. For example, Basler blaze cameras return a data stream that is composed of range, intensity, and confidence components. To access the individual components, you can use the class.

An IDataContainer can hold one or more components. You can obtain a container by calling IGrabResult.Container. You can then use the container to query for the number of components by calling . To retrieve a specific component, you can call []. Each component in the container can be used to access the actual data, e.g., the range values, and its metadata. To iterate through the components, use an enumerator returned by IDataContainer.GetEnumerator(). If you use a foreach loop as in the example below, this is called implicitly.
A container can be stored on disk using or restored from disk using .
remarks.note: Any IDataContainer or IDataComponent must be disposed explicitly.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IDataContainer.Count
member.summary: The number of components available in the container.

remarks.para: Preconditions: The data container must be valid.
Thread Safety:This method is not thread-safe.
Error Safety: Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IDataContainer.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Random access to items per index.
member.param: The index of an item.
member.returns: Returns a single data component.

remarks.para: Preconditions: The data container must be valid.

para.b: Thread Safety: The method is not thread-safe.

remarks.para: Error Safety:Throws exception if index is out of range.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.IDataContainer.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Store the data container as a file.
member.param: Path to a file.

remarks.para: Preconditions: The data container must be valid.
Thread Safety: The method is not thread-safe.
Error Safety: Throws exceptions if the container cannot be saved.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.IDataContainer.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Load the data container from a file.
member.param: Path to an existing file.

remarks.para: Postconditions: The data container is valid.
Thread Safety:This method is not thread-safe.
Error Safety:This method throws
FileLoadException If the file cannot be loaded.
FileNotFoundException If the file was not found.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult
member.summary: Interface of the grab result data.

remarks.para: The grab result controls the reuse and the lifetime of the referenced pixel data buffer. If the original and all cloned grab results referencing a pixel data buffer are disposed, the pixel data buffer is freed or reused by the camera stream grabber (depending on the used buffer type). The data and the pixel data buffer are still valid after the original camera object has been disposed.
remarks.note: If the grab results are never disposed, the grabbing will stop with an input queue underrun.
remarks.para: The grab result interface is derived from . The interface provides the property . The grab result is considered a valid image if the is defined and and are larger than zero. The is provided as a byte array if no custom buffer factory is used. With a custom buffer factory the provided type is dependent on its specific implementation.

member.summary: The payload type.

remarks.para:
Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.PaddingY
member.summary: The number of data bytes added to the end of the image data.

remarks.para:
Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.summary: Horizontal offset from the left side of the sensor to the image ROI.
member.returns: Horizontal offset from the left side of the sensor to the image ROI. This specifies the position of the image ROI. Only defined if the grab result contains image data.

remarks.para:
Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.summary: Vertical offset from the top of the sensor to the image ROI.
member.returns: Vertical offset from the top of the sensor to the image ROI. This specifies the position of the image ROI. Only defined if the grab result contains image data.

remarks.para:

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.HasChunkData
member.summary: Indicates if chunk data is available.

remarks.para: This is the case if: a) the chunk mode is enabled for the camera device, b) the parameter of the camera object is set to true (default setting), c) chunk data node maps are supported by the transport layer of the camera device.

Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.summary: The collection of attached chunk data.

remarks.para: The returned collection can be empty.

Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.HasCRC
member.summary: Indicates if the buffer has a CRC checksum attached. A CRC checksum needs to be activated for the camera device. See the PayloadCRC16 chunk.

remarks.para:
Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.CheckCRC
member.summary: Indicates if the CRC checksum of the buffer is valid.
member.returns: Returns true if the CRC checksum is valid.

remarks.para:
Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.PayloadSize
member.summary: The current payload size in bytes.

remarks.para:
Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.BlockID
member.summary: The block ID of the grabbed frame. The format of the value depends on the camera device used.

remarks.para: GigE Camera Devices: The sequence number starts with 1 and wraps at 65535. The value 0 indicates that this feature is not supported by the camera.
USB camera devices: The sequence number starts with 0 and uses the full 64 bit range.

Attention:
A block ID with the value UINT64_MAX indicates that the block ID is invalid and must not be used.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.Timestamp
member.summary: The camera specific tick count.

remarks.para: The tick count indicates when the image exposure was started. Cameras that do not support this feature return zero. If supported, this can be used to determine which image AOIs were acquired simultaneously.

Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.StreamGrabberUserData
member.summary: The UserData value assigned to the stream grabber object.

remarks.para: The UserData of the stream grabber is attached to the grab result when the grab result is retrieved.

Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.BufferUserData
member.summary: Get the pointer of the buffer context retrieved when calling .

remarks.para:
Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.ID
member.summary: The ID of the grabbed image.

remarks.para: Always returns a number larger than 0. The counting starts with 1 and is never reset during the lifetime of the Instant Camera object.

Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.ImageNumber
member.summary: The number of the image.
member.para: Always returns a number larger than 0. The counting starts with 1 and is reset with every call of IStreamGrabber.Start().

remarks.para:
Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.SkippedImageCount
member.summary: The number of images that were skipped before this image was acquired.
member.returns: Always returns a number larger than or equal 0. This number does not include the number of images lost in case of a buffer underrun in the driver.

remarks.para:
Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.Clone
member.summary: Clones the grab result for distribution of the grab result data to different modules. All clones must be disposed. The cloned grab result references the same grab result data. No grab result data is copied.
member.returns: Returns a new grab result referencing the same grab result data.

remarks.note: If the grab results are never disposed, the grabbing will stop with an input queue underrun.
remarks.para:
Error Safety:
Can throw exceptions.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IGrabResult.Container
member.summary: Retrieves the container with the data components.

remarks.para: Any grab result containing an image can create a data container. Some cameras can return grab results consisting of multiple components.
Preconditions: The grab result must be valid.
Error Safety: Does throw exceptions.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.IParameterCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of parameters that are identified by a path, a name, and a type.

remarks.para: Every parameter collection has a main parameter path. When looking up parameters of the main path, the path can be omitted. The definition of a main parameter path depends on the source of the related parameter collection. For simplicity, a combination of path, name, and type is referred to as parameter name, analogous to file names.

list.item: Parameter name without path: "Width"
Parameter name with path: "@CameraDevice/Width"
Parameter name with name cast for defining the parameter type: (IntegerName) "@CameraDevice/Width"

remarks.para: For ease of use, several predefined lists of parameter names are available, e.g. PLCamera.
If a requested parameter does not exist, an empty parameter object will be returned to simplify handling. An empty parameter is never readable or writable.
A parameter collection is enumerable. The enumerator lists all user parameters.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.IParameterCollection.Refresh
member.summary: Advanced: Invalidates all cached values for all parameters. See for more information.

remarks.para:
Thread Safety:
This method is synchronized with the source of the parameter collection.

Error Safety:
Can throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.IStreamGrabber.Stop
member.summary: Stops the grabbing of images.

list.item: If the camera object not currently grabbing, nothing is done.
The configuration event is fired. Possible exceptions from event calls are caught and ignored. All event handlers are notified.
The AcquisitionStop command of the camera device is executed.
The grabbing is stopped.
All buffer queues are cleared.
If the grabbing has been stopped successfully, the configuration event is fired. Possible exceptions from event calls are caught and ignored. All event handlers are notified.
The grabbing is stopped.
Grab specific parameters of the camera object are unlocked, e.g. .

remarks.para:
Thread Safety:
This method is synchronized with the camera.

Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.IStreamGrabber.RetrieveResult(System.Int32,Basler.Pylon.TimeoutHandling)
member.summary: Retrieves a grab result according to the grab strategy. Waits if the grab result is not yet available.
member.param: The timeout period in milliseconds for waiting for a grab result. Alternatively, the value can be set.
The action to perform when the functions exits with a timeout. If set to ThrowException, a timeout exception is thrown on timeout.
member.returns: Returns the grab result.

list.item: Waits for a grab result if it is not yet available. Camera events are handled.
One grab result is retrieved per call (OneByOne grab strategy is applied).
If chunk mode is used, chunk data parsing is performed. The grab result data is updated using chunk data.
If a grab result becomes available, the image event is fired. The notification of event handlers stops when an event call triggers an exception.
If the maximum number of images has been grabbed, the grabbing is stopped by calling .

remarks.para: You must check whether the grab represented by the grab result has been successful. For more information, see .

list.item: There is no other thread waiting for a result.
If no grab result has been retrieved, an empty grab result is returned in the grabResult parameter.
If the maximum number of images has been grabbed, grabbing is stopped.
If camera event handling is enabled and camera events were received, at least one or more camera event messages have been processed.

remarks.para:
Thread Safety:
This method is synchronized with the camera.

Error Safety:
The camera object is still valid after an error. The grabbing is stopped if an exception is thrown.

remarks.para: This method throws exceptions on timeout .

Grabbing single images using a software trigger (see ) is recommended if you want to maximize frame rate. This is because the overhead per grabbed image is reduced compared to single frame acquisition (see ). The grabbing can be started using . Images are grabbed using the , , and methods instead of using . Grabbing can be stopped using when done.

member.name: P:Basler.Pylon.IStreamGrabber.BufferFactory
member.summary: Sets an alternative buffer factory that is used for buffer allocation.

remarks.para:
The use of this property is optional and intended for advanced use cases only.
If null is passed as buffer factory then the default buffer factory is used. Buffers are allocated when is called. A buffer factory must not be disposed while it is attached to the stream grabber object and it must not be disposed until the last buffer is freed. To free all buffers the grab needs to be stopped and all grab results must be released or destroyed.

Thread Safety:
This property is synchronized with the camera.

Error Safety:
Does not throw exceptions.

member.name: E:Basler.Pylon.IStreamGrabber.ImageGrabbed
member.summary: Occurs when an image has been grabbed.

remarks.para: The grab result passed can be evaluated here. It will be disposed when the call returns. If you want to keep the grab result, you must save it using the method. For more information, see .

Thread Safety:
This event handler is synchronized with the camera.

Error Safety:
Exceptions from this call will propagate through. The notification of event handlers stops when an exception is triggered.

This handler is synchronized with the camera.

Exceptions from this call will propagate through. The notification of event handlers stops when an exception is triggered.

members.member:
$4D$
Provides a convenient way to save video files.

!4D!
Creates and opens a file for video writing.
File name of the video file to be created. Existing files will be overwritten. Playback speed in frames per second. The pixel type of the images that will be added to the video writer. This input is used to derive the video format. Width of the video. Height of the video.
Default compression options appropriate for the format will be used.
Preconditions:
The file is writable.
Depending on the video format used, not all pixel types may be supported.
width and height must be greater than 0.
Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe.
Error Safety: Can throw exceptions if the file cannot be created successfully or the preconditions are not met.

!4D!
Creates and opens a file for video writing.
File name of the video file to be created. Existing files will be overwritten. Playback speed in frames per second. The camera from which the current settings are read.
This overload reads the PixelType, Width, and Height parameters from the camera passed. Default compression options appropriate for the format will be chosen.
Preconditions:
The file is writable.
The camera must be open.
Depending on the video format used, not all pixel types may be supported.
Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe.
Error Safety: Can throw exceptions if the file cannot be created successfully or the preconditions are not met.

$4D$
Returns the open state of the video file.
Returns true if a file for video output has been opened.
Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe.
Error Safety: Does not throw exceptions.

$4D$
Closes the file.
Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe.
Error Safety: Does not throw exceptions.

$4D$
Checks whether the given image can be added to the video file without prior conversion.
The image to be checked. Returns true if the image can be added to the video stream without prior conversion. Returns false if the image would be automatically converted when Write() is called. Returns false if the image cannot be added at all. See the preconditions of Write() for more information.
Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe.

$4D$
Checks whether the given data/image can be added to the video file without prior conversion.
The pixel type of the image. Width of the image. Height of the image. The number of extra data bytes at the end of each row. Orientation of the image. Returns true if the image can be added to the video stream without prior conversion. Returns false if the image would be automatically converted when Write() is called. Returns false if the image cannot be added at all. See the preconditions of Write() for more information.
Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe.

$4D$
Adds the image to the video. Converts the image to the correct format if required.
The image to be added.
If required, the image is automatically converted to the target format.
Preconditions
Create() has been called successfully.
The image passed is valid.
The pixel type of the image to add is a format supported by pylon.
The width and height of the image match the values passed when opening the video file.
Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe.
Error Safety: Throws an exception if the image cannot be added.

!4D!
Adds the image to the video. Converts the image to the correct format if required.
The data of the image to be added. The pixel type of the image. Width of the image. Height of the image. The number of extra data bytes at the end of each row. Orientation of the video. Most codecs support ImageOrientation.BottomUp only. The data type of pixels stored in pixelData.
If required, the image is automatically converted to the target format.
Preconditions
Create() has been called successfully.
The image passed is valid.
The pixel type of the image to add is a format supported by pylon.
The width and height of the image match the values passed when opening the video file.
Thread Safety: This method is thread-safe.
Error Safety: Throws an exception if the image cannot be added.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.IWaitObject
member.summary:
A platform independent wait object.
Wait objects are used by the Pylon.IStreamGrabber and Pylon.IEventGrabber interfaces to provide a platform independent mechanism for allowing an application to wait for data buffers to be filled.
For the Windows version of pylon, WaitObjects are wrappers for Win32 objects that can be used with \c WaitForSingleObject() and \c WaitForMultipleObjects().
For the Linux version of pylon, WaitObjects are implemented based on file descriptors.The wait operation is implemented using the \c poll() function.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.IWaitObject.Wait(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Wait for the object to be signaled
member.param: timeout in ms
member.returns: false when the timeout has been expired, true when the waiting was successful before the timeout has been expired.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.IpConfigurator
member.summary: This class provides helper functions to work with IP based camera devices.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.IpConfigurator.AnnounceRemoteDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Announce that a remote device is going to be used.
member.param: Address of device in "dot notation".
member.returns: Returns if the camera device is found.

remarks.para: This is necessary when working with IP-based camera devices that are behind a router.In order to succeed, that camera device must be reachable and a route configured.Most system setups will not need this.If all your camera devices are found using the CameraFinder, you will not need this.The announcement can be reverted using RenounceRemoteDevice().

Please note that devices announced using this function are only remembered temporarily. If you annouce a device and then stop using pylon in your program, the underlying pylon might get disposed and the information about announced devices is lost. It is recommended to hold at least one pylon object from the time this function is called to the time the device is opened.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.IpConfigurator.RenounceRemoteDevice(System.String)
member.summary: Stop using remote device.
member.param: Address of device in "dot notation".
member.returns: Returns true if successful, false otherwise.

member.summary: Change the IP configuration of a camera device.
member.param: The MAC address of the camera device.
The to be used.
member.returns: Returns true if successful, false otherwise.
member.remarks: This overloaded method is for AutoIP or DHCP. To configure a public staticIP address, use the other overload.

member.summary: Change the IP configuration of a camera device.
member.param: The MAC address of the camera device.
The to be used.
The target IP address of the camera device.
The target subnet mask of the camera device.
The target default gateway of the camera device.
member.returns: Returns true if successful, false otherwise.
member.remarks: This overloaded method is for a public staticIP address. To configure AutoIP or DHCP, use the other overload.

members.member:
Enumerates all available GigE Vision devices.
In contrast to the CameraFinder::Enumerate method, devices having a subnet configured that is different from the subnet of the application will be listed.
Returns a list of objects, one per camera found.

Checks if camera device supports persistent IP configuration, also known as public staticIP configuration.
Static IP means that you assign an IP address to the camera that will stay in place even when the camera is powered off and back on again. You may also have to specify a subnet mask and a gateway. Make sure that the camera is in the same subnet as the adapter and that the camera has a unique IP address.
Error Safety: Can throw exceptions if the parameter is invalid. An object specifying the camera device.
Returns true if supported, false otherwise.

Checks if camera device supports DHCP configuration.
DHCP means that a DHCP server assigns an IP address to the camera.
Error Safety: Can throw exceptions if the parameter is invalid. An object specifying the camera device.
Returns true if supported, false otherwise.

Checks if camera device supports automatic IP configuration, also known as link-local address.
AutoIP, also known as Link Local Address (LLA), means that the camera uses automatic IP address assignment and assigns itself an IP address.
Error Safety: Can throw exceptions if the parameter is invalid. An object specifying the camera device.
Returns true if supported, false otherwise.

Checks if camera device is working in persistent IP configuration, also known as public static IP configuration.
Static IP means that you assign an IP address to the camera that will stay in place even when the camera is powered off and back on again. You may also have to specify a subnet mask and a gateway. Make sure that the camera is in the same subnet as the adapter and that the camera has a unique IP address.
Error Safety: Can throw exceptions if the parameter is invalid. An object specifying the camera device.
Returns true if active, false otherwise.

Checks if camera device is working in DHCP configuration.
DHCP means that a DHCP server assigns an IP address to the camera.
Error Safety: Can throw exceptions if the parameter is invalid. An object specifying the camera device.
Returns true if active, false otherwise.

Checks if camera device is working in automatic IP configuration, also known as link-local address.
AutoIP, also known as Link Local Address (LLA), means that the camera uses automatic IP address assignment and assigns itself an IP address.
Error Safety: Can throw exceptions if the parameter is invalid. An object specifying the camera device.
Returns true if active, false otherwise.

remarks.para: The library is initialized implicitly by using an object of the library, e.g. by creating a Camera object, or by calling one of its static methods, e.g. CameraFinder.Enumerate(). The internal resources of the library are freed when the application domain is unloaded.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.PixelDataConverter
member.summary: Creates new images by converting a source image to another format.

remarks.para:
Supported input image formats defined by the pixel type:
Mono1packed
Mono2packed
Mono4packed
Mono8
Mono10
Mono10packed
Mono10p
Mono12
Mono12packed
Mono12p
Mono16
BayerGR8
BayerRG8

BayerBG8
BayerGR10
BayerRG10
BayerGB10

BayerGR12

BayerGB12Packed

BayerGR10p

BayerGB12p

BayerGR16

BayerGB16
BayerBG16
BiColorRGBG8
BiColorBGRG8
BiColorRGBG10
BiColorBGRG10
BiColorRGBG10p
BiColorBGRG10p
BiColorRGBG12
BiColorBGRG12
BiColorRGBG12p
BiColorBGRG12p
RGB8packed
BGR8packed
RGBA8packed
BGRA8packed
RGB10packed
BGR10packed
RGB12packed
BGR12packed
RGB12V1packed
RGB16packed
RGB8planar
RGB16planar
YUV422packed
YUV422_YUYV_Packed
YUV422packed
YUV422_YUYV_Packed
YCbCr422_8_YY_CbCr_Semiplanar
YCbCr420_8_YY_CbCr_Semiplanar
Confidence8
Confidence16
Coord3D_C8
Coord3D_C16
Error8
Supported output image formats defined by the pixel type:
BGRA8packed - This pixel type can be used in Windows bitmaps.
BGR8packed - This pixel type can be used in Windows bitmaps.
RGB8packed
RGB16packed
RGB8planar
RGB16planar
Mono8
Mono16
All input image formats can be converted to all output image formats.

Limitations: The last column of an YUV input image with odd width cannot be converted. The last column and the last row of a Bayer input image cannot be converted.
The default treatment of rows and columns that cannot be converted due to their location on edges can be controlled using the @PixelDataConverter/InconvertibleEdgeHandling parameter. For more information, see the Convert() method description.
Thread Safety: The PixelDataConverter class is not thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.PixelDataConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor sets up the internal components required for pixel data conversion, including the image format converter, parameter collection, and node map attachment. It ensures that the Pylon library is initialized for further operations.
member.remarks: The constructor performs the following actions: 1. Initializes an instance of . 2. Configures and attaches the parameter collection with the appropriate node map. 3. Initializes the Pylon library using .

You can access parameters by passing a key from a parameter list to the index operator, e.g. key from a parameter list, e.g.
camera.Parameters[PLFormatConverter.OutputPaddingX].GetValue();

member.summary: Computes the size of the destination image buffer in byte. Use to convert to 32 bit if necessary.

member.returns: The size of the destination image when converting the given source image using current converter settings. Use to convert to 32 bit if necessary.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.PixelDataConverter.GetBufferSizeForConversion(Basler.Pylon.PixelType,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the size of the destination image buffer in byte. Use to convert to 32 bit if necessary.
member.param: The pixel type of the source image.
The number of pixels in a row in the source image.
The number of rows in the source image.
member.returns: The size of the destination image when converting the source image using current converter settings. Use to convert to 32 bit if necessary.

list.item: The sourceWidth value must be >= 0.
The sourceHeight value must be >= 0.

remarks.para: Thread Safety: This method is not thread-safe.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.PixelDataConverter.Convert(System.IntPtr,System.Int64,Basler.Pylon.IImage)
member.summary: Creates a new image by converting an image to a different format.
member.param: The pointer to the buffer of the destination image.
The size of the buffer of the destination image.
The source image.

remarks.para: The image is converted to the destination image according to the current converter settings. The padding area of a row in the destination image is set to zero.

list.item: The format of the source image must be supported by the converter.
The destination image buffer must be large enough to hold the destination image.
The source image buffer and the destination image buffer must not be identical.

remarks.para: Thread Safety: This method is not thread-safe.

member.name: T:Basler.Pylon.WaitObjects
member.summary: A set of wait objects.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.WaitObjects.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty wait object set.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.WaitObjects.Add(Basler.Pylon.IWaitObject)
member.summary: Add an object to wait on and return the index of the added object. Calling Add from another thread during wait operations will cause undefined behaviour.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.WaitObjects.RemoveAll
member.summary: Removes all added wait objects. Calling RemoveAll from another thread during wait operations will cause undefined behaviour.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.WaitObjects.WaitForAll(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Wait for all objects to get signaled.
member.param: maximum wait period in milliseconds
member.returns: true if all objects were signaled

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.WaitObjects.WaitForAny(System.UInt32,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Wait for any one object to get signaled.
member.param: maximum wait period in milliseconds
Will be set to the index of the signaled object.
member.returns: true if any object was signaled.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.WaitObjects.WaitForAllEx(System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Wait for all objects to get signaled.
member.param: maximum wait period in milliseconds
If true, the wait operation can be interrupted (Windows: APC; UNIX: signal)

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.WaitObjects.WaitForAnyEx(System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Wait for any one object to get signaled.
member.param: maximum wait period in milliseconds
If true, the wait operation can be interrupted (Windows: APC; UNIX: signal)
Will be set to the index of the signaled object.

member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.name: M:Basler.Pylon.WaitObjects.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources.
